Activity: Jimmy Carter was sworn in as 39th President of the U.S. The oath of office was administered by Chief Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court Warren E. Burger. Fora list of guests seated on the Inaugural platform, see APPENDIX"A." Members of the press
The President delivered his Inaugural Address. ThePresi- dent's remarks were broadcast live over worldwide tele- vision and radio.
The President and the First Lady went to room S-206 in the U.S. Capitol

The President siqned his nominations to the Senate for 11 Cabinet positions, the Director of the Office of Manage-. ment and Budget (omB) and the Chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers and the Ambassador of the U.S. to the United Nations. For a list of nominations, see APpENDIx. "B. "
The President and the First Lady attended a buffet luncheon. For a list of luncheon guests, See APPENDIX "C.
The President and the First Lady went to their motorcade.
The President and the First Lady departed their motorcade.

The President and the First Lady walked from the U.S. Capitol to the Inaugural Parade reviewing stand in front of the White House. They were accompanied by members of their family. Members of the press
The President and the First Lady went inside the Inaugural Parade reviewing stand. For a list of guests seated in. the reviewing stand, see . APPENDIX "D."
The President and the First Lady reviewed the Inaugural Parade, Members of the press
The President and the First Lady went to the North Portico of the White House..
The President participated in a question and answer session with members of the press..
The President and the First Lady toured the State Floor Residence
The President and the First Lady toured the second floor Residence, They were accompanied by members of the Carter family. For a list of attendees, see ApPENDIX "E."
The President went to the Ova1 Office.
The President met with: Hamilton Jordan,.. Assistant Tim Kraft, Special Assistant for Appointments
The President talked with Mr. Kraft.
The President met with Joseph M. "Max" Cleland, former. Georgia State Senator and disabled Vietnam veteran.
The President met with members of his family.
The President met with State Assemblyman Charles Warren (D-California)
The President met with Colorado State Treasurer Sam W. Brown.
The President met with: Griffin B. Bell. Attorney General-designate
Robert J. Lipshutz, Counsel
Charles Kirbo, partner with King and Spalding law firm, Atlanta, Georgia
Mr. Jordan
Jody Powell, Press Secretary
The President returned to the second floor Residence
The President had dinner with: The First Lady Amy Carter. Chip and Caron Carter. Jack and Judy Carter. Jeff and Annette Carter. Mrs. Lillian Carter,. the President's mother
The President was telephoned by his Assistant for Congres- sional Liaison, Frank Moore. The call was not completed..
The President,. the First Lady, and their daughter Amy went to the South. Grounds of the White House..
The Presidential party motored from the South Grounds to the Old Pension Office Building... 5th and G Streets, N.w..
The President, the First Lady, and Amy attended an Inaugural party, Members of the press
The President, the First Lady, and Amy returned to their motorcade.
The Presidential party motored from the Old Pension Building to the Mayflower Hotel, 1127 Connecticut Avenue, N. W.
The Presidential party attended two Inaugural parties. Members Of the press
The President and the First Lady returned to their motorcade
The President and the First Lady motored from the Mayflower Hotel to the Washington Hilton Hotel, 1919 Connecticut Avenue,N.W.
The President and the First Lady attended two Inaugural parties. Members of the press
The President and the First Lady returned to their motorcade
The President and the First Lady motored from the Washington. Hilton Hotel to the Shoreham Americana Hotel, 2500 Calver1 Street,N.W.
The President and the First Lady attended two Inaugural parties. Members of the press
The President and the First Lady returned to their motorcade
The President and the First Lady motored from the Shoreham Americana Hotel to the Sheraton Park Hotel, 2660 Woodly Road,N.W.
The President and the First Lady were greeted by: Walter F. Mondale, Vice President Mrs. Walter F. Mondale
The President and the First Lady attended an Inaugural party. Members of the press
The President and the First Lady returned to their motorcade.
The President and the First Lady motored from the Sheraton Park to the National Visitors. Center, Union Station.
The President and the First Lady were greeted by Chief of Protocol Shirley Temple Black..
The President and the First Lady greeted members of the Washington Diplomatic Crops
The President and the First Lady attended an Inaugural party,  Members of the press
The President and the First Lady returned to their motorcade,.
The President and the First Lady motored from the National Visitors Center to the District of Columbia National. GuardArmory, 20011 East Capitol Street.
The President and the First Lady attended an Inaugural party, Members of the press.
